name: my_params_to_list
description: Write a function named my_params_to_list that creates a new list from the command line arguments. The address of the list’s first node is returned.

name: my_list_size
description: Write a function called my_list_size that returns the number of elements on the list.

name: my_rev_list
description: Write a function named my_rev_list that reverses the order of the list’s elements

name: my_apply_on_nodes
description: Write a function named my_apply_on_nodes that applies a function, given as argument, to the data of each node on the list.

name: my_apply_on_matching_nodes
prototype: int my_apply_on_matching_nodes(linked_list_t *begin, int (*f)() , void const *data_ref, int (*cmp)());
description: Write a function named my_apply_on_matching_nodes that applies a function, given as argument, to the data of the nodes on the list equal to the data_ref given as argument.

name: my_find_node
description: Write a function named my_find_node that returns the address of the first node, which contains data equal to the reference data

name: my_delete_nodes
prototype: int my_delete_nodes(linked_list_t **begin, void const * data_ref, int (*cmp)());
description: Write a function named my_delete_nodes that removes all nodes containing data equal to the reference data

name: my_concat_list
description: Write a function named my_concat_list that puts the elements of a begin2 list at the end of a begin1 list.

name: my_sort_list
description: Write a function named my_sort_list that sorts a list in ascending order by comparing data, nodeto-node, with a comparison function.

name: my_add_in_sorted_list
description: Write a function named my_add_in_sorted_list that creates a new element and inserts it into an sorted list, so that the list remains sorted in ascending order

name: my_merge
description: Write a function named my_merge that integrates the elements of a sorted list, begin2, into another sorted list, begin1, so that begin1 remains sorted in ascending order.
